### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Coal Mine at Position (41.0, -86.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (41.0, -86.0)
- Burner mining drill at position (43.0, -86.0)
- Wooden chest at position (43.5, -84.5)
- Wooden chest at position (41.5, -82.5)
- Burner inserter at position (41.5, -83.5)
- Transport belt at position (41.5, -84.5)

#### Iron Ore Mine at Position (-17.0, -52.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (-17.0, -52.0)
- Wooden chest at position (-16.5, -50.5)
- Burner inserter at position (-17.5, -50.5)
- Stone furnace at position (-15.0, -51.0)
- Burner inserter at position (-14.5, -52.5)
- Wooden chest at position (-13.5, -51.5)
- Stone furnace at position (-13.0, -50.0)
- Burner inserter at position (-11.5, -50.5)

### ERROR TIPS

#### Errors when extracting items from a chest with insufficient quantity
- Ensure the chest contains the required quantity of items before attempting to extract them. Check the inventory of the chest to confirm the item count.

#### Errors when placing entities on occupied tiles
- Verify that the target tile is unoccupied before placing an entity. Use the `can_place_entity` function to check tile availability.

#### Errors when mining drills are out of fuel
- Ensure mining drills are fueled with coal or other appropriate fuel sources to maintain operation. Regularly check and refuel mining drills to avoid interruptions.

#### Errors when chests at drop positions are full
- Regularly empty chests at drop positions to allow mining drills to continue operation. Use inserters or manually transfer items to other storage solutions.

#### Errors when furnaces have no ingredients to smelt
- Ensure furnaces are supplied with the necessary raw materials for smelting. Use inserters to automate the transfer of items into furnaces.
